==Japanese==

===Kanji===

|goon=[[じゅ]] (ju)

|kanyoon=[[すう]] (sū)

===Etymology 1===
<div style="float:right;">
[[File:HinaDolls-Emperor-Empress-topplatform2011.jpg|thumb|right|{{lang|ja|雛}} (''hina''): Emperor and Empress ''hina'' dolls, in front of gold screens. The optional lampstands are also partially visible.]]
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ひな}}

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|ひな|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ひな}}

# a type of small [[doll]], typically standing upright in the Heian period, changing style to a seated posture in the Muromachi period
# short for {{l|ja|雛祭り|tr=Hina matsuri}}
# a [[chick]], a young [[bird]]: see the reading ''hiyoko'' below

====Prefix====
{{ja-pos|prefix|ひな|rom=hina}}

# [[diminutive]] prefix, carrying [[favorable]] connotations such as a sense of [[cuteness]]

=====Compounds=====
{{der-top|Compounds using {{lang|ja|雛}} (''hina'')}}
* {{ja-l|雛遊び}}, {{ja-l|雛遊|ひなあそび|hina asobi}}: playing with ''hina'' dolls
* {{ja-l|雛霰|ひなあられ|hina arare}}: a type of {{m|ja|霰|tr=arare||tiny [[rice]] [[cracker]]s}} given as an [[offering]] to the ''hina'' [[doll]]s on [[Hina matsuri]]
* {{ja-l|雛合わせ}}, {{ja-l|雛合|ひなあわせ|hina awase}}: a [[visit]] to play with ''hina'' dolls; particularly, such a visit on [[Hina matsuri]]
* {{ja-l|雛市|ひないち|hinaichi}}: a [[market]] selling ''hina'' [[doll]]s and [[accoutrement]]s for [[Hina matsuri]]
* {{ja-l|雛会|ひなえ|Hinae}}: alternate name for [[Hina matsuri]]
* {{ja-l|雛送り}}, {{ja-l|雛送|ひなおくり|hinaokuri}}: alternate for {{ja-l|雛流し||hinanagashi}}: see below
* {{ja-l|雛男|ひなおとこ|hina otoko}}: an [[elegant]] and [[refined]] man
* {{ja-l|雛菓子|ひながし|hinagashi}}: [[sweets]] given as [[offering]]s on the {{m|ja|雛壇|tr=hina dan||special tiered display for ''hina'' dolls}} at [[Hina matsuri]]
* {{ja-l|雛形}}, {{ja-l|雛型|ひながた|hinagata}}: a [[model]] or [[miniature]]; a [[sample]] or [[specimen]]; the front [[peak]] of an {{m|ja|折烏帽子|tr=ori eboshi||a tall formal peaked black hat}}
* {{ja-l|雛形尺|ひながたざし|hinagatazashi}}: a [[bamboo]] [[ruler]] made to be as long as the width of a [[bolt]] of [[cotton]] [[fabric]]
* {{ja-l|雛蚊屋吊}}, {{ja-l|雛蚊帳釣|ひながやつり|hinagayatsuri}}: {{taxlink|Cyperus flaccidus|species|noshow=1}}, a type of {{m|ja|蚊帳吊草|tr=kayatsurigusa||[[sedge]]}} native to wet areas in Honshū, Shikoku, and Kyūshū
* {{ja-l|雛鑑定器|ひなかんていき|hina kanteiki}}: a [[chicken tester]] {{qualifier|a device}}
* {{ja-l|雛鑑別者|ひなかんべつしゃ|hina kanbetsusha}}: a [[chicken sexer]] {{qualifier|a job}}
* {{ja-l|雛桔梗|ひなぎきょう|hinagikyō}}: a type of [[bluebell]] or [[bellflower]] of the [[genus]] {{taxlink|Wahlenbergia|genus|noshow=1}}
* {{ja-l|雛菊|ひなぎく|hinagiku}}: ''[[Bellis perennis]]'', a [[daisy]]
* {{ja-l|雛衣|ひなぎぬ|hinaginu}}: [[clothes]] for a ''hina'' [[doll]]
* {{ja-l|雛罌粟}}, {{ja-l|雛芥子|ひなげし|hinageshi}}: ''[[Papaver rhoeas]]'', the common field or red [[poppy]]
* {{ja-l|雛事|ひなごと|hinagoto}}: alternate for {{ja-l|雛遊び||hina asobi}}, playing with ''hina'' [[doll]]s
* {{ja-l|雛尖|ひなさき|hinasaki}}: the [[clitoris]]; the part of an {{ja-l|烏帽子||eboshi}} just below the front [[peak]] that [[protrudes]] slightly
* {{ja-l|雛桜|ひなざくら|hinazakura}}: {{taxlink|Primula nipponica|species|noshow=1}}, a type of [[primrose]] or [[cowslip]], called a "mini [[cherry blossom]]" for the shape of its flower
* {{ja-l|雛裁ち}}, {{ja-l|雛裁|ひなだち|hinadachi}}: a {{ja-l|一つ身||hitotsumi}}, a short [[kimono]] for [[children]] up to the age of one or two years old, made from one piece of [[fabric]] and without a [[seam]] up the back
* {{ja-l|雛壇}}, {{ja-l|雛段|ひなだん|hina dan}}: a special [[tiered]] display for ''hina'' [[doll]]s (see image below); a similarly tiered [[platform]] for [[kabuki]] musicians; the tiered seats for [[minister]]s in the [[Diet]]
* {{ja-l|雛鶴|ひなづる|hinazuru}}: a [[crane]] chick; a [[shōgun]]'s or [[daimyō]]'s [[daughter]]
* {{ja-l|雛鳥|ひなどり|hinadori}}: alternate for ''hiyoko'' ("chick"): see also Noun entry below
* {{ja-l|雛流し}}, {{ja-l|雛流|ひなながし|hinanagashi}}: letting loose small boats made of paper, ceramic, or other materials and holding ''hina'' dolls on rivers or the sea on the night of [[Hina matsuri]]
* {{ja-l|雛人形|ひなにんぎょう|hina ningyō}}: a ''hina'' [[doll]]: see also Noun entry below
* {{ja-l|雛の臼壺|ひなのうすつぼ|hina no usutsubo}}:
* {{ja-l|雛の簪|ひなのかんざし|hina no kanzashi}}: an [[annual]] plant of the [[family]] [[Polygalaceae]], a type of [[milkwort]]
* {{ja-l|雛の錫杖|ひなのしゃくじょう|hina no shakujō}}: an [[annual]] [[flowering plant]] of [[family]] ''[[Burmanniaceae]]''
* {{ja-l|雛の錫杖科|ひなのしゃくじょうか|hina no shakujōka}}: ''[[Burmanniaceae]]'', the [[botanical name]] for a [[family]] of [[monocot]] [[flowering plant]]s
* {{ja-l|雛の節句|ひなのせく|Hina no Seku}}: alternate name for [[Hina matsuri]]
* {{ja-l|雛の節句|ひなのせっく|Hina no Sekku}}: alternate name for [[Hina matsuri]]
* {{ja-l|雛の使い|ひなのつかい|hina no tsukai}}: in [[modern]] Japan, the act of sending relatives a display of outfitted ''hina'' dolls for [[Hina matsuri]]
* {{ja-l|雛保育器|ひなほいくき|hina hoikuki}}: a [[chick]] [[incubator]]
* {{ja-l|雛祭り}}, {{ja-l|雛祭|ひなまつり|Hina matsuri}}: [[girl|Girl]]'s [[day|Day]], the [[doll]] [[festival]]
* {{ja-l|雛屋|ひなや|hinaya}}: a [[dollhouse]] for ''hina'' [[doll]]s; a store selling ''hina'' dolls
* {{ja-l|雛欄|ひならん|hina ran}}: an [[orchid]] of the [[genus]] {{taxlink|Amitostigma|genus|noshow=1}}, native to East Asia
{{der-mid}}
* {{ja-l|初生雛|しょせいひな|shosei hina}}: a newly [[hatched]] [[chick]] that has just started eating
* {{ja-l|後の雛|のちのひな|Nochi no Hina}}: the [[counterpart]] to [[Hina Matsuri]], held on the ninth day of the ninth month in the old [[lunar calendar]]
* {{ja-l|初雛|はつひな|hatsu hina}}: a [[girl]]'s first [[springtime]] [[seasonal]] [[celebration]]; the ''hina'' dolls set out as decoration at such a time
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ひいな}}

{{IPAchar|/hihina/}} → {{IPAchar|/hiːna/}}

Possibly an alteration of reduplicated ''hinahina''.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|ひいな|acc=1}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ひいな|hhira=ひひな}}

# {{lb|ja|archaic|sort=ひいな}} [[doll]]

=====Usage notes=====
This reading with the long ''ī'' is archaic. In modern Japanese, the shorter reading ''hina'' is more common for this sense.

=====Compounds=====
{{der-top|Compounds using {{lang|ja|雛}} (''hīna'')}}
* {{ja-l|雛遊び}}, {{ja-l|雛遊|ひいなあそび|hīna asobi}}: playing with ''hina'' dolls
* {{ja-l|雛合わせ}}, {{ja-l|雛合|ひいなあわせ|hīna awase}}: a [[visit]] to play with ''hina'' dolls; particularly, such a visit on [[Hina matsuri]]
* {{ja-l|雛衣|ひいなぎぬ|hīnaginu}}: [[clothes]] for a ''hina'' [[doll]]
* {{ja-l|雛草|ひいなぐさ|hīnagusa}}: alternate name for {{ja-l|髢草||kamojigusa}}, a type of [[wild]] [[rye]] or [[wheatgrass]]
* {{ja-l|雛本|ひいなぼん|hīnabon}}: a type of small children's [[book]] in the Edo period used at [[Hina matsuri]] and when [[play house|playing house]]
* {{ja-l|雛祭り}}, {{ja-l|雛祭|ひいなまつり|Hīna matsuri}}: [[girl|Girl]]'s [[day|Day]], the [[doll]] [[festival]]
* {{ja-l|雛屋|ひいなや|hīnaya}}: a [[dollhouse]] for ''hina'' [[doll]]s; a store selling ''hina'' dolls
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 3===
<div style="float:right;">
[[Image:Chick.jpg|thumb|right|{{lang|ja|雛}} (''hiyoko''): A baby chicken (chick), ''Gallus gallus domesticus'']]
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ひよこ}}

Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=ひよこ|ひよ|tr1=hiyo|t1=[[onomatopoeia]] for the sound a chick makes|子|tr2=ko|t2=diminutive suffix}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|ひよこ|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ひよこ}}

# [[chick]], young [[bird]]
# [[child]]; [[youngling]], [[greenhorn]]

=====Compounds=====
{{der-top|Compounds using {{lang|ja|雛}} (''hiyoko'')}}
* {{ja-l|雛豆|ひよこまめ|hiyoko mame}}: the [[chickpea]] or [[garbanzo]] [[bean]]
* {{ja-l|雛胚|ひよこはい|hiyoko hai}}: a [[chick]] [[embryo]]
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 4===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ひよっこ}}

{{IPAchar|/hijoko/}} → {{IPAchar|/hijokko/}}

Alteration of ''hiyoko'' above. The [[geminate]] ''kk'' sound emphasizes the diminutiveness.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|ひよっこ|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ひよっこ}}

# a [[chick]], a young [[bird]]
# a [[child]]; a [[youngling]], a [[greenhorn]]

===Etymology 5===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|すう}}

{{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=すう}}. Most reconstructions of the original {{etyl|ltc|-}} reading start with an {{l|en|affricate}}, so this Japanese reading may have come from a dialect; compare {{etyl|hak|-}} reading ''ts'u<sup>1</sup>''.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanyo|すう}}

====Affix====
{{ja-pos|affix|すう}}

# [[young]], [[new]], a [[greenhorn]]

=====Usage notes=====
Only used in compounds.

=====Compounds=====
{{der-top|Compounds using {{lang|ja|雛}} (''sū'')}}
* {{ja-l|雛妓|すうぎ|sūgi}}: alternate name for a {{ja-l|半玉||hangyoku}}, an [[apprentice]] [[geisha]]
* {{ja-l|雛僧|すうそう|sūsō}}: a young [[monk]], a [[novitiate]]
{{der-mid}}
* {{ja-l|育雛|いくすう|ikusū}}: [[raising]] [[chick]]s
* {{ja-l|臥竜鳳雛|がりょうほうすう|garyō hōsū}}: a [[diamond in the rough]], an [[unnoticed]] [[greatness]]
* {{ja-l|伏竜鳳雛|ふくりょうほうすう|fukuryō hōsū}}: a [[diamond in the rough]], an [[unnoticed]] [[greatness]]
* {{ja-l|鳳雛|ほうすう|hōsū}}: a very [[promising]] [[young man]], a [[boy]] with very high [[prospect]]s
* {{ja-l|帰趨|きすう|kisū}}: a [[return]] [[arrival]], [[getting]] [[back]] to one's starting point
{{der-bottom}}
